contentrichtext.text: [[Image:20040312-5 012t8724-515h.jpg|thumb|President George W. Bush greets Dr. Raja Habib al-Khuzaai]] '''Raja Habib al-Khuzaai''' was a member of the [[Interim Iraq Governing Council]], created following the [[United States]]'s [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], and one of only three women on the twenty-five-member governing body.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/3062897.stm|title=Iraqi Governing Council members|publisher=[[British Broadcasting Company]]|accessdate=17 March 2011|date=14 July 2003}}</ref> She has also been a member of the [[Iraqi National Assembly]], elected under the banner of the [[United Iraqi Alliance]]. Although she lived in the [[United Kingdom]] in the 1960s and 1970s, she returned to Iraq in 1977. A [[Shia]] Muslim, al-Khuazaai is a medical doctor<ref>Dawson, Ashley and Malini Johar Schueller. [http://books.google.com/books?id=sKTiyHCT9KQC&pg=PA148 ''Exceptional state: contemporary U.S. culture and the new imperialism'']. Durham: Duke University Press, 2007, ISBN 978-0-8223-3805-5.</ref> who currently directs a maternity hospital in the southern Iraqi city of [[Diwaniyah]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Al-Khuzaai, Raja Habib | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Member of the [[Iraqi National Assembly]] | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Khuzaai, Raja Habib}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iraqi women in politics]] {{Iraq-politician-stub}}
